definition: to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Once the tire failure, accompanied the spare tire will come in handy.
sentences.chinese: 一旦轮胎发生故障，随车携带的备胎就可派上用场。

sentences.english: So you're giving us two spares?
sentences.chinese: 那你能给我们两个备胎吗？

sentences.english: Should I check the air in the spare tyre as well?
sentences.chinese: 要检查一下备胎的气吗？

sentences.english: A mounting device is arranged on the last-stage bracket and used for mounting a spare tire.
sentences.chinese: 所述末级支架上设置安装装置，用于安装备胎。

sentences.english: An underfloor tray in the rear covers the spare tire and hides valuables from prying eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一个地板托盘后方包括备胎和皮革贵重物品从窥探。

sentences.english: Our car had a flat tire.
sentences.chinese: 每辆车子应带一个备胎。

sentences.english: Weld spare wheel housing with the fire wall with an interrupted full weld under shielding gas.
sentences.chinese: 用气体保护间断全焊，将备胎罩与防火墙焊接。

sentences.english: Competes immediately stops, Sweden coach helped him to trade a spare tire deftly.
sentences.chinese: 随即比赛中止，瑞典教练麻利地帮助他换了一个备胎。

definition: to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
a man who is family-oriented, considerate and protective
"green tea bitch", a girl who seems innocent and charming but is actually calculating and manipulative
"Mr Perfect" (i.e. tall, rich and handsome) (Internet slang)
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
sb who is romantically involved with sb already in a committed relationship/the other woman/the other man/third person/third party (in dispute)/disinterested party/number three in a list
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
